did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle: Barnes Family Papers, 1797-1926, 1818-1875.
did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, chiefly 1820-1875, of Newman Williamson Barnes and his wife Margaret W.(Tomlin) Barnes of Richmond, Virginia and "Greenfield," Culpeper County, Virginia. Letters concern life in Falmouth, Virginia and also concern Fredericksburg, Virginia. Correspondents are members of the Braxton, Coalter, Tomlin and Oliver families.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Barnes Family Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The following genealogical information is known about the Barnes family. Margaret W. Tomlin and Newman Williamson B. Barnes had the following children: Margaret W., George B., Beverley, Robert Tomlin, Walker, and Lucy Ball. Newman Williamson B. Barnes had the following sisters: Lucy Barnes, Frances C. Barnes, and Balsora Barnes. Other genealogical materials can be found in the "additional related material" section.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Collection contains correspondence, chiefly 1820-1875, of Newman Williamson Barnes and his wife Margaret W.(Tomlin) Barnes of Richmond, Virginia and "Greenfield," Culpeper County, Virginia and to their daughter, Margaret W. Barnes. Letters concern life in Falmouth, Virginia and also concern Fredericksburg, Virginia. Correspondents are members of the Braxton, Coalter, Tomlin and Oliver families. Letters contain social and family news.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically by date.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 9 series: 1. Correspondence, 1810-1829; 2. Correspondence, 1830-1849; 3. Correspondence, 1850-1869; 4. Correspondence, 1870-1930; 5. Correspondence, n.d.; 6. Envelopes; 7. Financial Papers; 8. Newspaper Clipings; and 9. Poetry.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional genealogical information, the Tomlin Family Chart, and other materials related to this collection can be found under the Brown-Coalter-Tucker Papers (I and II), Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

did.unittitle:
Correspondence,
1810-1829.
F[rances] C. B[arnes], Falmouth, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 17 Sept. [l8]18.

scopecontent.p: Re: disappointed in NWBB's not writing; Lucy, Margaret T[omlin], and Bal[sora] [Barnes] are at Fitzhugh's; have tried to fatten up Judy - Margaret has fattened considerably here; shirts are finished; everyone has been well except Aunt Short; love from Mama and the girls to NWBB and George.

did.unittitle: Mary [W.] Tomlin, Falmouth, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 3 Sept. 1820.

scopecontent.p: Re: family's four week stay at the Wilderness and the one week visit of Major Jones and family; improvement of Mothers' health; some gentlemen of Fredericksburg serenaded this town last night.

did.unittitle: Lucy H. Oliver, Frederick, [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 18 Sept. 1821.

scopecontent.p: Re: arrived at Frederick after a fatiguing journey; Lucy, Nancy, and LHO have been sick with ague and fever; LHO is taking children of deceased aunt to live with her ; the children are young and need counsil [sic] and advise.
Also includes a letter by Lucy Barnes, Frederick, [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia]. Re: LB's health.

did.unittitle: Lucy H. Oliver, Retreat, [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 19 Jan. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: the girls have gone off to spend the day with Mr. and Miss Bassett amusing themselves with toys; should be very much pleased to be agreeably surprised with NWBB's company; had a letter from Lucy saying all are in good health.

did.unittitle: J[udy] H. Tomlin, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 21 Jan. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: behavior on Sunday has been the subject of the neighbor's discussion since NWBB's departure; has been said that JHT is ill-mannered and rude.
Also includes a letter by Margaret W. Tomlin, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia]. Re: family news.

did.unittitle: Frances C. Barnes, [Falmouth], [Virginia], to [Newman] W[illiamson] B. Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 22 Jan. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: asks why he has not written his brother; received a letter from Lucy, mentions NWBB's debt, FCB will pay at any time; Mr. George has commenced his school.
Also includes a note by L[ucy?] H.[?] Barnes, [Falmouth], [Virginia], to [Newman] W[illiamson] B. Barnes, Richmond, Virginia Fragment.

did.unittitle: Balsora E. Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], to Newman W[illiamson] B. Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 30 Jan. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: BEB is taking a course in grammar and is pleased with studies - geography, history, chemistry, rhetoric, composition; Cousin Williamson's wedding to Lucy.

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 12 Feb. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: JHT is returning book, please send another; relates gossipy items in a religious text.

did.unittitle: F[rances] C.. Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], to New[man] W[illiamson] B. Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 16 Feb 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: laments that Mama chose FCB for the topic of her last letter; family news items; wedding at Elwood.

did.unittitle: Balsora Barnes, Union Academy, [Virginia], to [Newman] [Williamson] [B.] [Barnes], [Richmond], [Virginia], 29 Feb. 182[2].

scopecontent.p: Re: BB's writing capabilities and responsibilities.

Also includes a letter by Frances [C.] [Barnes], Union Academy, [Virginia], to [Newman] [Williamson] [B.] [Barnes], [Richmond], [Virginia]. Re: arrival of daughter in family. Also includes incomplete letter.

did.unittitle: Lucy H. M. Barnes, Eliwood, [Virginia], to N[ewman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 19 Mar. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: family news; Betty is a bright student of Wilson's; we should help make the remainder of our parents' years happy and contented; NWBB's interest in a woman - marriage? - don't keep it a secret.

did.unittitle: G[eorge] W. Bass[ett], Farmington, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 23 Mar. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: reveals feelings toward women and expresses his dislike for women to have a freedom of expression.

did.unittitle: L[ucy] H. Oliver, Retreat, [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 10 May 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: repair of goods and purchase of goods; an invitation to visit Sunday next.

did.unittitle: Lucy H. Oliver, Union Hall, [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 11 Aug. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: purchase of goods requested and money sent.

did.unittitle: Lucy H. Oliver, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 14 Sept. 1822.

scopecontent.p: Re: purchase of goods requested and money sent; looking forward to NWBB's visit.

did.unittitle: [Lucy] H. Oliver, Retreat [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Hanover Town, [Virginia], 14 Jan. 1823.

scopecontent.p: Re: will give ten dollars to repair the shop; purchase of goods requested.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m B. Dabney, Richmond, [Virginia], to Newman W[illiamson] B. Barnes, Hanover Town, Hanover Co., Virginia, 4 Sept. 1823.

scopecontent.p: Re: arrived in Richmond, NWBB not married yet; other news of activities since being in Virginia

did.unittitle: Margaret [W.] Tomlin, Union Hall, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Hanover Town, Virginia, 17 Sept. 1823.

scopecontent.p: Re: received NWBB's letter; waiting for NWBB's visit; request for shoes.

did.unittitle: F[rances] C. Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], to New[man] W[illiamson] [B.] Barnes, Hanover Town, Virginia, 26 Oct. 1823.

scopecontent.p: Re: have been slighted by NWBB not spending any time with us this fall; the fever has been raging in Fredericksburg but not so badly here; travel plans.

Also includes a letter by Lucy Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], to New[man] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Hanover Town, Virginia. Re: have not been in a humor to write; everyone is in good health; anxious to see NWBB.

did.unittitle: Corbin Braxton, Retreat, [Virginia], to N[ewman] W[illiamson] [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 23 Sept. 1824.

scopecontent.p: Re: Sarah P. [Oliver] was taken by a fatal chill - instructions on the building of the coffin.

did.unittitle: Lucy H. Oliver, Retreat, [Virginia], to Newm[an] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 30 Sept. 1824.

scopecontent.p: Re: the loss of LHO's daughter, Sarah, and LHO's deep sense of grief.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 5 Feb. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: MWT's religious convictions and health.
Also includes a note by J[udy] H. Tomlin, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia]. Re: thanks NWBB for what he sent.

did.unittitle: Margaret [W.] Tomlin, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 24 Feb. 1825.
Margaret W. Tomlin, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 5 June 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: arrangements for next Sunday.
Also includes a letter by M[ary] W. Braxton, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia].

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Hybla, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 1 Aug 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: have inclination to write to NWBB as frequently as ever; family news, please send several items.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Falmouth, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 5 Sept. 1825.
Judy H. Tomlin, Hybla, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond. [Virginia], 27 Sept. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: health of family and neighborhood; newsy items about family.

did.unittitle: Balsora T. [?] Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 3 Oct. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: newsy items about the activities of friends and relatives including the Pages, Jones, Coalters, Peytons, Brookes,...; mentions good water and pure water in [Falmouth].

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Hybla, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 8 Oct 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: fabrics sent and items made from fabrics; please send more flannel, silk, and shoes.

did.unittitle: L[ucy?] M. H[?] Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 10 Oct. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: health news; activities of family members and neighbors.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes,. Richmond, [Virginia], 15 Oct. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: MWT states her affection toward Willy and how MWT desires his presence.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 17 Nov. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: NWBB's visit to Falmouth.
Also includes a letter by L[ucy?] H. [?] Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia]. Re: NWBB's forthcoming visit; LHB places an order for 3 books.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 13 Dec. 1825.

scopecontent.p: Re: Thanks NWBB for the books, ring, and calico - values the ring most highly; request for additional goods from Richmond.

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, Henrico Co., [Virginia], 18 Apr. 1826.

did.unittitle: Balsora [Barnes], Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Virginia, 2 May 1826.

scopecontent.p: Re: cousin Lucy's health; forget and forgive for the slight NWBB received on his last visit here.
Also includes a letter by M[argaret] W. Tomlin, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, Virginia. Re: NWBB's next visit will be a welcomed one.

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Chericoke, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 16 May 1826.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Retreat, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 17 May 1826.
F[rances] C. B[arnes], Falmouth, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 22 May 1826.

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Falmouth, [Virginia], to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 27 June 1826.

scopecontent.p: Re: Lucy's health; [John] [Tayloe] Lomax has been appointed a professor in the University at Charlottesville; [flood] waters have devastated bridges and other things here; orders fabric from Richmond

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Tomlin, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 21 July 1826.

scopecontent.p: Re: family news - everyone has been sick.

did.unittitle: Zach[aria]h Vawles, Falmouth, Virginia, to Newman W[illiamson] B. Barnes, Richmond, [Virginia], 21 July 1826.

scopecontent.p: Re: explanation of Vawles' absence when NWBB visited; will make arrangements to pay back money owed.

did.unittitle: Judy H. Tomlin, Falmouth, Virginia, to [Newman] Williamson [B.] Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 9 Aug. 1826.

scopecontent.p: Re: news of family and activities in the town.

did.unittitle:
Correspondence,
1830-1849.
Balsora Barnes, Cumberland, New Kent C[our]t Ho[use], Virginia, to Margaret W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Richmond, Virginia, 13 Mar. 1833.

scopecontent.p: Re: health of family members, declares love for George; send news of MWTB's children.

did.unittitle: Balsora Barnes, n. p., to Margaret W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia, 25 Mar. 1834.

scopecontent.p: Re: BB is anxious to get down; shall send Peg a bedstead; news of family activities; had hoped the chimney would be done before BB got home and had wanted to paint the dining room; Willy's visit.

did.unittitle: [?], Richmond, [Virginia], to [Newman] [Williamson] [B.] [Barnes] ?, n.p., 28 July 1834.

scopecontent.p: Re: have not written because of sore eyes

did.unittitle: R[obert] W. Tomlin, Office of Stone Wall Residency, [Stone] [Wall] [Mills], [Virginia], to "Sister" [Margaret] [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Jeffersonton Post Office, Culpeper County, Virginia, 28 Aug 1835.
Corbin Braxton, Warm Springs, [Virginia], to Margaret W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Jeffersonton, Culpepper County, Virginia, 25 Sept. 1836.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Hybla, [Virginia], to Margaret [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Green Field, near Jeffersonton, Culpepper Co[unty], [Virginia], 3 Dec. 1836.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Hybla, [Virginia], to Balsora Barnes, Falmouth, Stafford Co[unty], [Virginia], 3 Aug 1837.

scopecontent.p: Re: health of family members; death of Benedict Crump - thrown from a horse; we're in need of rain and in the midst of a terrible drought.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Lodge, [Virginia], to Margaret W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Green Field, near Jeffersonton, Culpepper Co[unty], [Virginia], 19 Aug. 1837.

scopecontent.p: Re: sorry to hear MWTB's been sick; MWB's happiness depends a great deal on that of her sisters and brothers; it has not been pleasant since the girls left home; health of family members.

did.unittitle: L[ucy] M. B[arnes], n.p., to Margaret W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, [Virginia], 21 Aug. 1837 [?].

scopecontent.p: Re: Willy's illness and health news of other family members.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Chericoke, [Virginia], to Margaret [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Falmouth, Stafford Co[unty], [Virginia], 25 Nov. 1837.

Also includes a letter by Bal[sora] [Barnes], Chericoke, [Virginia], to M[argaret] [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Falmouth, Stafford Co[unty], [Virginia]. Re: family news.

did.unittitle: R[obert] W. Tomlin, Office of Stone Wall Residency, Stone Wall Mills, Virginia, to "Sister" [Margaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Jeffersonton Post Office, Culpeper County, Virginia, 1 Dec. 1837.
R[obert] W. T[omlin], Stone Wall Residency, [Stone Wall Mills], Lynch[bur]g, Virginia, to "Sister" [Margaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, care of Balsora Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia, 4 Apr. [18]38.
Nancy [fl, Chericoke, Virginia, to Balsora Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia, 3 June 1838.

Also includes a letter by J[udy] H. [Tomlin] Coalter, Chericoke, [Virginia], to Balsora Barnes, Falmouth, Virginia Re: Mr. C[oalter]'s health; instructions on what to do at the house.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Chericoke, [Virginia], to Margaret [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Green Field, near Jeffersonton, Culpepper Co[unty], [Virginia], 15 Sept. 1838.
Balsora Barnes, n.p., to Margaret W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, Culpeper [County], [Virginia]. 3 pp. ALS. 4 Feb. 1839.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Chericoke, Virginia, to Margaret [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, near Jeffersonton, Culpepper Co[unty], [Virginia], 21. Oct. 1839.

Also includes a letter by B[alsora] B[arnes], [Falmouth], [Virginia], to M[argaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, [Jeffersonton P. O.], [Culpeper County], [Virginia]. Re: additional details about the celebration of the Queen of May day.

did.unittitle: Margaret [W.] Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], to "Mama" [Margaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, Culpepper C[oun]t[y], [Virginia], l[?] June 1840[?].

scopecontent.p: Re: why hasn't MWTB written; MWB wants to know news of health of MWTB and NWBB; tells of Aunt Lucy's and MWB's colds; Aunt Fanny and sister's visit to Fredericksburg to hear Doctor Plu[?] and Doctor Alexander preach.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Browne, Fred[ricksbur]g, [Virginia], to [Margaret] [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], 24 Oct. 1840.

scopecontent.p: Re: MWTB's health and possible remedies for a cure.

did.unittitle: R[obert] W. T[omlin], Balcony Falls, [Virginia], to "Sister" [Margaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Jeffersonton p. o., Culpepper County, Virginia, 21 Nov. 1840.

scopecontent.p: Re: winter's effect on people; RWT's attitude toward romance.

did.unittitle: M[argaret] W. Barnes, Falmouth, [Virginia], to "Papa" N[ewman] W[illiamson] [B.] Barnes , Greenfield, near Jeffersonton, Culpeper C[ounty], [Virginia], 15 Dec. 1840.[?].

scopecontent.p: Re: news of events in Falmouth; reminds NWBB to come and get her at Christmas.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Chericoke, [Virginia], to Margaret [W.] Tomlin] Barnes, Green Field, Jeffersonton, P. 0., Culpepper Co[unty], [Virginia], 12 Feb. 1841.

scopecontent.p: Re: MWB's anniversary and Armistead's 16th birthday; accounts of Armistead's visit home; family news including Lucy's health and Robert's forthcoming marriage.

did.unittitle: M[argaret] W. Barnes, Fredericksburg, [Virginia], to "Father" N[ewman] W[illiamson] [B.] Barnes, n.p. With a note by L., 1 Mar. 1841.

scopecontent.p: Re: all are well except Grandma; General Harrison passed through Fredericksburg; hope MWB will profit by your good advice; Aunt Bal[sora] will teach the boys this spring and summer.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Braxton, Chericoke, [Virginia], to Margaret [W.] [Tomlin] Barnes, Green Field, Jeffersonton p. 0., Culpepper Co[unty], [Virginia], 23 Apr. 1841.

scopecontent.p: Re: family news; Robert's marriage; MWB fell down the potato hole and bruised herself; health of family members.

did.unittitle: R[obert] W. Tomlin, Office of Blue Ridge Residency, Balcony Falls, [Virginia], to N[ewman] W[illiamson] [B.] Barnes, Fox's Mills P. 0., Acquire County, Virginia, 12 Sept. 1841.

did.unittitle: Margaret W. Barnes,, Falmouth, [Virginia], to "Mother" [Margaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, Culpepper Co[unty], Virginia, 20 May 1842[?].
[Margaret] [W.] [Barnes], Falmouth, [Virginia], to "Mother" M[argaret] W. [Tomlin] Barnes, Greenfield, Culpepper Co [unty], Virginia, 18 June l842[?].

did.unittitle:
Correspondence,

scopecontent.p: Re: the winter has been filled with much sickness and death; / affectionate comments on household slave, Louisa, catching on fire and dying 2 days later; Judy is making a trip to Gloucester; Walker's health has not been good this winter; Fanny looks remarkably well; heard there was a chance that MWTB might move near Falmouth - is it true?; who has written to whom; Dr. Braxton has had much to weigh him down - which has always affected his health; love to MWTB, Willy, and the boys.

did.unittitle: Margaret [W.] Barnes, Presley, [Virginia], to Tomlin [Barnes], n.p., 24 Feb. 1850.

scopecontent.p: Re: glad TB's in school; behave and learn your lessons; the family misses you.

scopecontent.p: Re: apologetic towards JHTC and MWTB's lack of corresponding; rejoice in MWTB's being at Pinewood; JHTC's boys have left for the University; events of Christmas day; JHTC's given up all hopes of getting the place you heard of; love to Peggy, Willy, the boys, and the girls in Falmouth; St. sends his love to all.

scopecontent.p: Re: JWT fulfills a promise to send a composition or two - one about whether a republican government can exist and the other whether the circumstances of the Romans justified them in [?] their first dictator; JWT looks for money requested every day.

Also includes a letter, n.d., by W. Tomlin, n.p., to John W. Tomlin, [William Mary College], [Williamsburg], [Virginia]. Re: received your composition which am well pleased with; irate discussion of JW's responsibility as a son to WT including JWT's extravagance with money, JWT 's education, etc. Cy.
